thread.title: New charges for Levittown man who beat his German shepherd, DA says
thread.title_full: New charges for Levittown man who beat his German shepherd, DA says | Newsday

author: John Valenti
title: New charges for Levittown man who beat his German shepherd, DA says
text:
Michael Gallagher, 56, of Levittown, was arrested Friday, Dec. 23, 2016, after he used a shovel to severely beat his 11-year-old German shepherd, who had to be euthanized because of her injuries, Nassau police said. Gallagher faces new charges after a grand jury indictment on Tuesday, Feb. 21, 2017, the Nassau district attorney said. (Credit: Howard Schnapp) 

A Levittown man arrested last year has been indicted on a series of animal cruelty charges, including the torturing and injuring of animals, after authorities said he used a shovel to beat his 11-year-old German shepherd so severely in December that the dog had to be euthanized.
Michael Gallagher, 56, was arraigned Tuesday before Acting Supreme Court Justice Teresa Corrigan, charged with aggravated...
